Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Currently, it seems that the link panel is always activated on hover, regardless of whether the user actively moved the cursor or the cursor was indirectly made to hover over the link by some other means, such as keyboard scrolling, tab switching or application switching. That is annoying since the link panel obscures part of the page, maybe necessitating even more scrolling or moving the mouse pointer manually to be able to read the whole page without obstructions.


How to reproduce:
0) Navigate to a page containing links.
1) Position the mouse pointer within the page.
2) Using the keyboard, scroll the page so that a link will end up under the mouse pointer.

Current behavior: The link panel is activated and obscures the content at the bottom of the page. The panel does not go away until you somehow move the mouse pointer away from whatever link it happened to hover. It is annoying to repeatedly have to move the mouse pointer to a "safe" place when reading a page that needs scrolling.

Desired behavior: Either the link panel should not be activated at all unless the user actively moved the mouse pointer, or the link panel should time out after a short while in such cases.
comments.creator: per.angstrom@autark.se
